meanings.definition: Somewhat poor in quality or condition.
meanings.sent1: The old car had a poorish paint job.
meanings.sent2: The house looked poorish with its peeling paint.
meanings.sent3: The poorish quality of the toy made it break easily.
meanings.sent4: The poorish condition of the road made driving difficult.
meanings.sent5: The poorish fabric of the shirt felt rough against my skin.

meanings.sent1: She sang poorish at the talent show.
meanings.sent2: He played the piano poorish during the recital.
meanings.sent3: The chef cooked poorish, but the dish still tasted good.
meanings.sent4: The team performed poorish in the game, but they still won.
meanings.sent5: The student answered poorish on the test, but managed to pass.
